topic.title: Using Mac OS X Installer
topic.shortdesc: Installation of the agent with the Mac OS X installer

body.p: The FusionInventory project provides two Mac OS X packages: one for powerpc computers and the other for Intel macs.
The package is a .pkg file designed for silent installation. Agent's configuration needs to be done before installing, by going into the package, and edit the Content\Resources\agent.cfg file.
By default, the agent runs as a daemon, and stores its files in /opt/fusioninventory-agent.
Please note that FusionInventory agent is not a Mac OS X application, and as such is invisible for users.
Once configured, the agent can be deployed either manually (by double clicking on the .pkg file), nor automatically using tools like Apple Remote Desktop.
